abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Community Nutrition
            Project (CNP) for the Lao People's Democratic Republic
            is to improve coverage of essential maternal and child
            health services and improve mother and child caring
            practices among pregnant and lactating women and children
            less than two years old in the seven southern and central
            provinces. CNP is not expected to cause negative social
            impacts. However, there may be issues associated with
            ensuring equitable access to project benefits and there are
            concerns that some villages will benefit more than others
            due to proximity and ease of accessibility to intervention
            health centres. A number of constraints in accessing health
            care services were identified by local populations,
            especially challenges related to physical access, the high
            cost of services, and the cost of transportation.
            Furthermore, the opportunity cost of abandoning crops in
            order to seek maternal and child care services are
            especially high for ethnic groups living in remote villages.
            To ensure equitable access to project activities, the Ethnic
            Group Development Plan (EGDP) provides an action plan that
            addresses the challenges faced by ethnic groups and ensures
            they benefit in a culturally appropriate way.
